column5: This past weekend I packed up and moved back to Sault Ste. Marie from London. I have been waiting to go steelheading for weeks and finally got out yesterday afternoon with my cousin.  We went 5 for 8 with the biggest being 28 inches. The first 4 fish were all females and were definitley all spawned out. The 5th fish was the smallest at 16 inches and was the only male. No pic of that one it was caught in a small river on the way home and the camera was in the car. Still snow patches in the bush and the water level was pretty good. Its feels great to be home......I love the north.....               Hopefully get out again this week....But i have to get some writing done so instead I may hit up some Atlantics in the boat....Its only 10 mins away.....Oh, all fish were released.....   TDunn
now thats what i call a stream. georgeous waters.  either your bottom half was sweatin bullets or your top half was freezing......which was it. Neoprenes and a t-shirt dont mix lol.
Freezing cold water........super hot sun.....actually got a bit of a sunburn......lol thats how we roll up here dude......lol
Good job man,  Water temp must be getting up there??  Let me know if you need someone to net those atlantics for you.
welcome home!
Its time for Atlantics? I gotta learn them too. Like I say,,,gotta learn that river, its too good not to fish there.  Seems wer'e starting to get a few from the Sault on here.
lol, id like to roll like dat
Very nice, gotta love that country up there.
looks like you found your own little gem, beautifull pics ( thanks for not blurring the backgrounds  )
Good to have you back!  Nice report, thanks for sharing!!
nice pics and awesome looking streams... thanks for sharing!    p.-
Very nice chrome looks like there is not much shoulder to shoulder up there.
looks like my favorite river was good to you! Good job... im missing the soo already...
Lord knows I've never fished there but this picture is incredibly familiar. Likely seen it in an issue of OOD at some time.  Great looking water !
Beauty report, thanks...

never did take the temp of the water but when i was handling the fish in the water my hands were ice cold....Ya i would think it would be rising but geeeez its still cold......PM me and we should get out this spring/summer for atlantics at some point....  TDunn
Thanks for the kind words guys....it is a true gem... I hope to get another report for you guys soon....  TDunn
Great report and pics TDunn  Good looking chrome and awesome honey hole!!! Well done you guys Thanks for sharing Leechman
Caught this earlier and liked it very much.  What a great looking spot for catching them beauties.
Wow!!!  Those are some nice looking fish and some incredible looking waters to be fishing!  Sure beat the drainage ditches I fish for those fish in!! LOL
